data.title: dinner
data.text: We live in Mansfield and eat there often. Best kept secret in Mansfield. Good food, inexpensive, stellar service, recently remodeled, very nice. Highly recommend

data.title: Jalisco
data.text: Boy this is one of my favorite places. Recently accomplished extensive add on and now has lots more room which I noticed was as full as usual the other day. the food is excellent with several choices, always tasty and superior service.

data.title: Average Mexican food...not Tex-Mex
data.text: Stopped in on a weeknight but was very disappointed in the food....it was okay if you are looking for very bland, tasteless Mexican food.....we are more of the spicy Tex-Mex preference, so this was not a good experience for us.

data.title: Good
data.text: The food is good, and the prices are reasonable, the hotsauce or salsa, is lacking. But the rest is good, cleanliness is an issue in the bathrooms or was the last couple times.

data.title: Good
data.text: Very good Mexican food. Friendly and fast service.  I've eaten here many times,  tried many dishes, all good.

data.title: Great local
data.text: Go here regularly.  Basic tex mex but always good and always very reasonably priced.   On nice days they have a porch you can sit. When the fire fighters who inspect got here you know it's gotta be clean?!  Always friendly and just north of historic downtown Mansfield.

data.title: Great Prices • Skimpy Toppings
data.text:
Wife and I came here Saturday night for dinner while there was a festival in downtown Mansfield.  My first comment is that the prices are right; unfortunately, the quality is a bit of a let-down.  We ordered Nachos Supremos with chicken.  This is supposed to be a plate of chip with beans, cheese, and chicken along with sides of sour cream, guac, and peppers.  What we go had no meat of any kind and no sour cream.

After we informed the waitress, she took our plate away and returned maybe 5 minutes later.  The replacement was made properly but it was terribly skimpy on everything but chips.  Most chips had just a light smattering of beans on one corner—seriously, just one corner—a fairly reasonable amount of cheese, and a couple very small cubes of chicken.

Our waitress was a bit stressed, but there was a lot of foot traffic, so I can't fault her there.  Beer was quite cheap (under $3 for Mexican imports), so that part was nice.  As for the food, what was there was decent; there just wasn't much there.  This place could be nice, but they have some work to do.

data.title: Favorite Mexican Brunch
data.text: If you're looking for Tex-Mex don't stop here. Just simple home style Mexican food. Not over spiced. Not greasy. Salsa and chips are fresh with a nice taste. My favorite brunch dish are the cheese enchiladas, verde salsa, and two fried eggs on top.

data.title: Not impressed at all
data.text: We just ate there and the food had no flavor the beans tasted as if they were old.   I will not return.

data.title: THE REAL DEAL
data.text: This is our favorite Mexican food restaurant.  It's real Tex-Mex made by real Tex-Mexicans and it's not expensive as good Tex-Mex should be.  The only thing on the menu that I don't like are the Tapas.  Not my favorite but their enchiladas are to die for.  I recommend this to any out of towner that asks where they can get good Mexican food.

data.title: Wonderful Place to eat often
data.text:
I am sort of surprised there are no reviews of this place, as they have been a pleasure for my Wife and Family to frequent for many, many years.

Perhaps it is just the local clientele simply not wanting more people to show up and compete for "their spot"  in the restaurant! While I tend feel the same way (LOL), these folks deserve some recognition and I want to see them stay in business for the rest of my existence.

To me, this is THE PLACE to go if you simply want good food, at a extremely reasonable price, served by a wonderfully friendly staff. The food is "Home Made" style well prepared, simply presented, extremely flavorful without all the heavy flavor enhancers and extra junk added that you can be allergic to. 

It is NOT the "Same ole - Same ole" type Tex-Mexican food out of a can that is cheap, tasteless and boring.They honestly have their own spin on a lot of the dishes (of which I generally approve of). On the other hand, to be balanced... there is only so many ways to fix the "the Basics" of this style of eating.

They serve the typical soft drinks as well as imported bottled sodas.
They also serve margaritas, as well as having a very decent variety of domestic and imported beers. 

The "Atmosphere" is extremely casual and simple (which I like).
The building is very "well used" but kept clean.
This "Casual Vibe" may put some people off if they are looking for a place to impress, but is comfortably inviting for those who are into grabbing their Family or a few good friends to have good food and conversation with, without taking out a loan from the bank.

I am telling you... this a place where you can eat often, have something different every time (or the same thing over and over) and consistently have a wonderful experience.

The Clientele is mostly local working class folks who really appreciate this gem.
The waitresses are all bilingual (English/ Spanish)  so everyone feels comfortably accommodated.  There never appears to be any wait staff drama or tension.
Everyone seems to work together well and are very polite.

I give them a hearty two thumbs up!
